content.question:
The figure shows the graph of the function <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> on the open interval <math alttext="open parenthesis, a comma b, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>b</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>. Let <math alttext="g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function given by <math alttext="g of x equals, the integral from 1 to x, of, f of t, d t" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>. Which of the following statements must be true?
<math alttext="g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is increasing on <math alttext="open parenthesis, a comma b, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>b</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>.
<math alttext="g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> has a relative maximum on <math alttext="open parenthesis, a comma b, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>b</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>.
<math alttext="g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> has exactly one zero on <math alttext="open parenthesis, a comma b, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>b</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>.

topic.text: 6.5: Interpreting the Behavior of Accumulation Functions Involving Area
